title: appledev124
author: appledev124
created_time: August 03, 2023, 02:03:39 AMLast edit: August 03, 2023, 02:41:49 AM by appledev124
content: Hello! I want to participate in Electrum development and add an iOS app to your ecosystem. I already have a strong experience in developing such wallets on iOS. Also I can improve MacOS version.In my opinion there are very few trusted open-source BTC wallets and unfortunately there are almost no one for iOS. I mean I can’t trust most BTC wallets on the App Store for different reasons. Some of them were made by weird companies and others are not open-source.And I want to fix it. I’ve already sent my CV to somber.night@protonmail.com and electrumdev@gmail.com but still haven’t got any answer. Maybe I can reach Electrum developers here.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.created_time: August 03, 2023, 07:55:25 AMLast edit: August 03, 2023, 08:11:29 AM by OmegaStarScream
comments.body: There's Unstoppable wallet which is open source, I have tried the Android version but never the iOS one: https://unstoppable.money/As for your sending your CV, then what for? I don't believe you need to send anything, you're free to contribute if you'd like to help:Quote from: https://github.com/spesmilo/electrumContributingAny help testing the software, reporting or fixing bugs, reviewing pull requests and recent changes, writing tests, or helping with outstanding issues is very welcome. Implementing new features, or improving/refactoring the codebase, is of course also welcome, but to avoid wasted effort, especially for larger changes, we encourage discussing these on the issue tracker or IRC first.Besides GitHub, most communication about Electrum development happens on IRC, in the #electrum channel on Libera Chat. The easiest way to participate on IRC is with the web client, web.libera.chat.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: appledev124 on August 03, 2023, 02:03:39 AMAnd I want to fix it. I’ve already sent my CV to somber.night@protonmail.com and electrumdev@gmail.com but still haven’t got any answer. Maybe I can reach Electrum developers here.Electrum is an open source project under MIT License. You do not need to ask the developers to accept your C.V, you can FORK for the project and create a special copy or start writing an improvement and take a cue from the current sources. The only difference is that the new version will not be signed by Electrum developers, and then the person who trusts you is the one who will download it.Quote from: https://github.com/spesmilo/electrum/blob/master/LICENCEPermission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaininga copy of this software and associated documentation files (the"Software"), to deal in the Software without restriction, includingwithout limitation the rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish,distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Software, and topermit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so.Start searching for bugs and fixing them or developing the UI, and if you achieve something useful, it will definitely be added to the project.

Some of them were made by weird companies and others are not open-source.Apart from Bluewallet which I believe is an open source bitcoin wallet on iOS, there is Bither, BitPay Wallet and Edge Wallet. Edge also supports other crypto assets besides bitcoin just like the Unstoppable wallet as we can see at bitcoin.org.Bluewallet is not yet available on the bitcoin.org site if we search, but bluewallet is a bitcoin wallet that can be trusted for use on iOS, including on Android.

comments.author: Minecache
comments.body: I have used many wallets but am really convinced by the simplicity and full range of features that I need in Electrum. I have been using it for years now and hardly use any other wallet. But what makes me regret the most is that it still doesn't have an iOS version even though many years have passed. I still see them actively improving the new desktop versions, but I don't know why they still can't make any version for iOS, even a beta version. OP, I really support your idea. But as everyone said, you should contact them on GitHub rather than here as they are inactive here. I hope to see Electrum on the app store soon.

However, the impact is that when opening the wallet, it takes longer for the synchronization process.The delayed synching occur when you have just created or imported the wallet.Not happening because it just created or imported a wallet, the synchronization process occurs every time we open the application after completing the passcode, especially when the first time opens the day in question.For example today I have not opened it, when I open it then it will happen. But it just happened once, when the wallet was closed, then when I entered again, the synchronization process was not repeated.Sometimes a circular circle in the Bitcoin icon on the Unstoppable wallet which indicates the synchronization process is running does not require a long time.
